page.title: 10SPEKE HALL.....
page.content: Speke Hall is situated about 8 miles from the centre of Liverpool on the north bank of the Mersey,and is one of the best examples of half-timbered houses in the country. The building was started in 1490 by Sir William Norreys. During the 16th. century it assumed its present quadrangular form around an enclosed courtyard. The original moat has disappeared, but the building looks much the same as it did towards the end of the reign of Queen Elizabeth I. The hall was owned by the Norris family until 1797, when it was bought by Richard Watt, a wealthy West Indian merchant.Basically,the interior of the hall reflects the taste and planning of the Norris family in the 16th century, but there is also the influence of the 19th century....
